summary: The Channel Tunnel, also known as the Chunnel, is a 31-mile undersea railway tunnel connecting England and France beneath the English Channel. Opened in 1994, it's the only fixed link between Great Britain and mainland Europe. The tunnel carries high-speed trains, cars, and freight. It was built by Eurotunnel after many earlier plans and attempts, and it cost around $22.6 billion. Despite some mechanical issues and fires, it remains a crucial transportation link.
title: Channel Tunnel
